**Chinese E.V.s Face Increase In U.S. Tariffs**

**Biden Considers a Tax as High as 100%**

**By ALAN RAPPEFORT**
**THE JAN UNSALTERLY**

The Biden administration is set to announce next week its high as 100% import tax on Chinese electric vehicles and dedicated imports of Chinese-made Chinese goods, and some semiconductors, as early as next week, according to people familiar with the matter.

The move could raise grid power concerns within automakers and government officials. Bidenâ€™s efforts to jumpstart domestic manufacturing of electric vehicles and boost U.S. battery production could be underfoot by China, which has quickly ramped global markets with cheap solar panels, batteries, electric vehicles and other products.

The long-awaited tariffs are the latest in a flurry of new rounds of the Biden and former President Donald J. Trump imposed on imports from 530 billion of Chinese-made goods in 2021. Most of the Trump tariffs were on autos, but they also applied to cars, cellphones, laptops, and other products. The Biden administration has said the tariffs are intended to protect American workers, which currently face a 25% tax on imported cars. The administration is expected to raise that to 30% and 100 percent in order to make it prohibitively expensive to buy a Chinese EV.
